intro: Metrosideros polymorpha var. subimbricaria, commonly known as the red-flowered Tahitian hibiscus, is a variant of the native Hawaiian hibiscus species. It is characterized by its vibrant red flowers, which bloom in clusters and attract pollinators such as birds and insects. The plant has heart-shaped, dark green leaves that are often covered in a fine, silvery pubescence. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, typically growing in coastal areas and moist lowlands. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ornamental species within the Malvaceae family.
